item.title: Automation Bias
item.description:
Don’t Let the Robots Take Over Your Brain: Understanding Automation Bias #

In our increasingly automated world, we’re constantly bombarded with data, predictions, and recommendations generated by algorithms. While these tools can be incredibly helpful, there’s a sneaky cognitive bias that can lead us astray: Automation Bias. This bias can make us over-rely on these automated systems, even when our own judgment tells us something is wrong. Let’s dive in and explore what it is, why we fall for it, and how to combat it.

item.title: Google Effect
item.description:
The Google Effect: Why We’re Forgetting What We Can Google #

In today’s hyper-connected world, information is available at our fingertips. But could this constant access be subtly changing how we learn and remember? Enter the Google Effect, also known as “digital amnesia,” a cognitive bias that explains our tendency to forget information we know we can easily find online using search engines. Sounds convenient, right? But understanding this effect is crucial for professionals, students, and anyone committed to sharp thinking.
